text: We have tried to obtain a rational transduction that approximates a bigram model , trained on the strings comprising 4 It uses a trie to represent productions ( similar to ELR both source and target sentences and reorder oper ators , as explained in Section 4 .

claim_evidence: a weighted context-free transduction of reasonable quality can be effectively learned from examples
evidence: Abstract Existing studies show that a weighted context-free transduction of reasonable quality can be effectively learned from examples .
text: Abstract Existing studies show that a weighted context-free transduction of reasonable quality can be effectively learned from examples .

evidence: Some of these studies have concentrated on finite-state or extended finite-state machinery , such as ( Vilar and others , 1999 ) , others have chosen models closer to context-free grammars and context-free transduction , such as ( Alshawi et al. , 2000 ; Watanabe et al. , 2000 ; Yamamoto and Matsumoto , 2000 ) , and yet other studies can not be comfortably assigned to either of these two frameworks , such as ( Brown and others , 1990 ) and ( Tillmann and Ney , 2000 ) .
text: Some of these studies have concentrated on finite-state or extended finite-state machinery , such as ( Vilar and others , 1999 ) , others have chosen models closer to context-free grammars and context-free transduction , such as ( Alshawi et al. , 2000 ; Watanabe et al. , 2000 ; Yamamoto and Matsumoto , 2000 ) , and yet other studies can not be comfortably assigned to either of these two frameworks , such as ( Brown and others , 1990 ) and ( Tillmann and Ney , 2000 ) .
